case_vignette: A 55-year-old man presents to the emergency department with an enlarged mass on his elbow he noticed this morning. He states that he has never seen it before. The patient has a past medical history of diabetes and a 35 pack-year smoking history. He recently started boxing to get into shape. His vitals are within normal limits. Physical exam is notable for a mass seen in Figure A, which is rubbery and non-tender.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?
